author: Staff Reporter
text:
District Elementary Education Office here has issued notices to private nursery and primary schools for failure to renew registration.

According to sources, when the officials scanned the list of 207 schools in the district, they found that 30 schools had failed to renew their registration that they were supposed to do every three years.

The schools had registered with the Office at the time of starting operations but failed to renew the registration thereafter. As part of the registration process, the schools should also furnish certificates relating to building , sanitary , fire safety and a few other documents.

The Office issued the notices a few days ago and gave the schools 15–20 days time to respond to those. Soon thereafter 15 schools had responded by applying for registration renewal, the sources said and added that they were waiting for others to respond.

Closure

If the schools failed to respond, the Office would send a reminder and even thereafter if there was no move to renew the registration, it would order the school’s closure, the officials added.
title: Education Department issues notices to 30 schools
